data.title: If settings search string contains a space, it should be more strict
data.body:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/21200547/7d8d315e-c1fc-11e6-9718-2e14dbaf06cd.png)

Since the search term is `terminal ar`, I'm explicitly indicating that they are different words so it should not return results matching `/a.+r/`.

data.title: Any reason settings search doesn't fuzzy search settings keys?
on linux, running debug results in error
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: xubuntu 16.10 4.8.0-30-generic
- Extension: ms-vscode.csharp

Steps to Reproduce:

1. follow [this](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/aspnet/core/tutorials/your-first-mac-aspnet) article
2. on running **Debug (F5)** following error displays: 
> ERROR: Debug adapter process has terminated unexpectedly

If i run *code --verbose*, i get following output:

> 
> [911:1214/201407:INFO:CONSOLE(34)] "%c[IPC Library: Watcher]", source: file:////usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js (34)
> [911:1214/201407:INFO:CONSOLE(34)] "%c[IPC Library: Watcher]", source: file:////usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js (34)
> [911:1214/201407:INFO:CONSOLE(34)] "%c[IPC Library: Watcher]", source: file:////usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js (34)
> [911:1214/201407:INFO:CONSOLE(34)] "%c[IPC Library: Watcher]", source: file:////usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js (34)
> [911:1214/201407:INFO:CONSOLE(5)] "[uncaught exception]: Error: read ECONNRESET", source: file:///usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/electron-browser/bootstrap/index.js (5)
> [911:1214/201407:INFO:CONSOLE(5)] "Error: read ECONNRESET
>     at exports._errnoException (util.js:1026:11)
>     at Pipe.onread (net.js:564:26)", source: file:///usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/electron-browser/bootstrap/index.js (5)
> [911:1214/201407:INFO:CONSOLE(160)] "Uncaught Error: read ECONNRESET", source: events.js (160)
> [911:1214/201407:INFO:CONSOLE(90)] "Debug adapter process has terminated unexpectedly", source: file:////usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js (90)
> [911:1214/201407:INFO:CONSOLE(121)] "%c[Extension Host]", source: file:////usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js (121)
> [911:1214/201407:INFO:CONSOLE(121)] "%c[Extension Host]", source: file:////usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js (121)
> [911:1214/201407:INFO:CONSOLE(121)] "%c[Extension Host]", source: file:////usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js (121)

From bash, command **dotnet run** executes correctly.

data.title: "next marker" goes to the first error, not the next error after the cursor
data.body:
Have this code:

```javascript
let x = /foo

// comment

let y = /bar
```

- Place the cursor on the comment
- Press F8 for `editor.action.marker.next`

1.7: The error on `/bar` is highlighted (correct)
1.8: The error on `/foo` is highlighted

If you press F8 again, then it highlights the second error. But the first time you press it, it should always go to the next error after the cursor, not the first one.

data.title: C# / Unity - Typing "override" does not offer any suggestion based on base class.
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.7.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

Typing "override" does not offer any suggestion based on base class. 

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install C# extension.
2. Create a class.
3. Create a protected or public virtual, or abstract, method.
4. Create a derived class.
5. Type "override".
6. Notice there is no suggestion based on the base class.

data.title: Golang 1.7.4 breaks navigation outside package
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version:

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install go 1.7.4
2. Try to navigate to a symbol outside the current package
3. Doesn't do anything

I've tried going back to Go 1.7.3 and navigation started working again.
I've tried placing `"go.docsTool": "gogetdoc"` in the user settings but found no difference.

- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.8.0-insider (2abfc207828739bd5b10d0bb8dbfea13506cfc69, 2016-12-13T09:48:23.832Z) - OS Version: Darwin x64 16.1.0 - Extensions: |Extension|Author|Version| |---|---|---| |material-icon-theme|PKief|1.1.4| |code-settings-sync|Shan|2.3.8| |sort-lines|Tyriar|1.1.0| |html-css-class-completion|Zignd|1.0.3| |Bookmarks|alefragnani|0.10.1| |project-manager|alefragnani|0.12.2| |one-monokai|azemoh|0.2.3| |vscode-icontheme-nomo-dark|be5invis|1.2.1| |vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.1.0| |githistory|donjayamanne|0.1.4| |tslint|eg2|0.7.1| |vscode-great-icons|emmanuelbeziat|1.1.26| |Angular2|johnpapa|1.0.2| |theme-karyfoundation-themes|karyfoundation|10.0.0| |HTMLHint|mkaufman|0.3.3| |vscode-stylefmt|mrmlnc|2.2.0| |Theme-1337|ms-vscode|0.1.2| |angular2-inline|natewallace|0.0.16| |nonbreakingspace|smlombardi|0.0.1| |vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|4.1.0| |stylelint|shinnn|0.20.4| |theme-tesla|smlombardi|5.3.9| |bootstrap-3-snippets|wcwhitehead|0.0.8| |change-case|wmaurer|1.0.0| --- Steps to Reproduce: 1. In a PHP file, and HTML block like this: ```html
PAST NEWS Archive
``` 2. Although I have the[ Bootstrap 3 snippets extension](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=wcwhitehead.bootstrap-3-snippets), and it works in HTML files, the above Bootstrap classes are not suggested here. This is also an issue with built-in Intellisense: add an attribute like "class" and although the word class is suggested, choosing it does not add the usual `=""` as it does in HTML files.

data.title: Getting "unable to get local issuer certificate" error while installing extension
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0.-insider
- OS Version: Windows 7 x64

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Getting "unable to get local issuer certificate" error while trying to install extension. 

VSCode settings already has below option. 

i am not using proxy url as we don't have any proxy url. (im under company proxy (Blue Coat SSLV) and its setup through pac file. all requests need to approve company root certificate which is self signed. i think i am getting above error because of this. )

"http.proxyStrictSSL": false

we had the same issue earlier with node npm install. after setting npm config with below settings it started to work. 

npm config set strict-ssl false

Do we have any steps to enable strict-ssl globally for VSCode (even if http.proxy value is empty)

3. the closing tag is not highlighted as it is in HTML pages

data.title: VS remotely controlled?
data.body:
I have been working on my projects for a few months. All of a sudden today, while I was making updates in the html and css docs, VS was not following what I type - almost as if my VS was being hacked and remotely controlled.  Then, every time pressed 'return' to go to a new line, it deleted lines of code that I had already typed. Furthermore, it would not allow me to 'undo' the changes that it was making. Thank God I have the codes saved in back up locations. I went onto VS's site to check for any updates and I tried debugging it but nothing worked so far.  Why is VS acting this way all of a sudden? 

- VSCode Version:
- OS Version: mac book pro

Steps to Reproduce:

1. 
2.

data.title: Ignore URL params when debugging and following Click to follow links in Debug Console
data.body:
_From @pjsvis on December 14, 2016 13:34_

1. I use a version param to help with cache busting
2. EG http://localhost:55693/OTS.UTP/scripts/app/SomeFile.js?v=20161114132417363:107:48 
3. When I click in the Debug Console to follow the link it reports Unable to open 'SomeFile.js?v=20161114132417363': File not found (\\localhost:55693\OTS.UTP\scripts\app\SomeFile.js?v=20161114132417363).
4. I guess this is because of the param
5. It would be a nice enhancement if you could ignore the param
6 Otherwise chrome debugger is tons of fun

_Copied from original issue: Microsoft/vscode-chrome-debug#307_

data.title: activationEvents onLanguage doesn't work with custom language
data.body: - VSCode Version: Version 1.7.2 - OS Version: OSX 10.9.5 Steps to Reproduce: 1. I've downloaded client+server extension example from https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-languageserver-node-example 2. After this I've added Gherkin language support via: ``` "languages": [ { "id": "feature", "aliases": [ "feature", "gherkin", "Gherkin", "cucumber" ], "extensions": [ ".feature" ], "configuration": "./language-configuration.json" } ] ``` and ``` "grammars": [ { "language": "feature", "scopeName": "text.gherkin.feature", "path": "./syntaxes/feature.tmLanguage" } ] ``` Current Result: After these steps, syntax highlighting working properly. Also, extension looks good for the plain text file type ('typescript' word is highlighting with error). But, it doesn't work for the 'feature' ("activationEvents": ["onLanguage:feature"]) - see screens. Was unable to find solution on this. Looks like an issue. Please assist. Thank you.

data.title: Accessibility:MAS13:Menus and context menu are not zooming in with the rest of the UI

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
VS Code Version:1.6.1
OS Version:1607
**Pre-Requisite:**
1.Open visual studio code editor.
2.Using "Ctrl+" key repeatedly To Zoom to the Maximum

**Steps to Reproduce:**
Scenario 1:
1.Open visual studio code editor.
2.Observe the Menu Bar Visually on Zoom
Scenario 2:
1. Open visual studio code editor.
2. Hit "Ctrl+Shift+G" to view the Git side bar and Navigate to more button and Hit Enter.
3. Observe the options under More button on Zoom
Scenario 3:
1. Open visual studio code editor.
2. Hit "Ctrl+Shift+X" to view the Extensions side bar and Navigate to more button and Hit Enter.
3. Observe the options under More button on Zoom.

**Expected Result:**
Scenario 1:
Menu Bar and options under Menu Bar should Adapt the Zoom feature of VS Code Editor
Scenario 2:
Icons under More in Git Repository  side bar should Adapt the Zoom feature of VS Code Editor
Scenario 3:
Icons under More in Extensions  side bar should Adapt the Zoom feature of VS Code Editor

**Actual Result:**
Scenario 1:
Menu Bar and options under Menu Bar is not adapting the Zoom feature of VS Code Editor
Scenario 2:
Icons under More in Git Repository  side bar are not Adapting the Zoom feature of VS Code Editor
Scenario 3:
Options under More in Extensions side bar are not Adapting the Zoom feature of VS Code Editor

**User Impact:**
Low Vision users will not be able to clearly view these options as they are not adapting the Zoom feature of the application

![scenario 1_menu bar and options under menu bar are not adapting the zoom feature of vs code editor](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21185893/808c3026-c238-11e6-984a-22ee652a4157.jpg)
![scenario 2_options under more button in git side bar is not adapting the zoom feature of vs code editor](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21185895/83a564c6-c238-11e6-8784-b11505d06065.jpg)
![scenario 3_options under more button in extensions side bar is not adapting the zoom feature of vs code editor](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21185898/87b38fb6-c238-11e6-96ff-5924f3ff0a41.jpg)

data.title: Accessibility:MAS42A: Disabled Icons appears as Enabled on mouse hover in High Contrast Mode.
data.body:
VS Code Version:1.6.1
OS Version:1607
**Pre-Requisite:**
1.Open visual studio code editor.
2.Using "Ctrl+Shift+P" key Open the command Pallete.
3.Type Theme, Navigate to Preferences: Color Theme and Hit Enter.
4.Navigate to High Contrast and Hit Enter.

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1.Open visual studio code editor.
2. Using "Ctrl+Shift+D", key navigate to the Debug side view bar option.
3. Open the launch.json file under the "Configure or Fix: launch.json"button and select "Node.js" from the drop down list.
4. Start debugging by pressing F5.
5. Observe the Disabled options like "Step Over", "Step Into" and "Step Out" on mouse over.

**Expected Result:**
Disabled Icons should appears as Disabled on mouse hover even in High Contrast Mode.

**Actual Result:**
Disabled Icons appears as Enabled on mouse hover in High Contrast Mode.

**User Impact:**
Low Vision users might not be knowing that these options are disabled and they will be expecting a change after Invoking these options.

![disabled icons appears as enabled on mouse hover in high contrast mode](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21185698/c26b8c9a-c237-11e6-9e4c-0d2b3313781a.jpg)

data.title: Accessibility:MAS42A: More colors in high contrast theme
data.body:
VS Code Version:1.6.1
OS Version:1607
**Pre-Requisite:**
1.Open visual studio code editor.
2.Using "Ctrl+Shift+P" key Open the command Pallete.
3.Type Theme, Navigate to Preferences: Color Theme and Hit Enter.
4.Navigate to High Contrast and Hit Enter

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1.Open visual studio code editor.
2. Using "Ctrl+Shift+E", key navigate to the Explorer button.
3. Using Tab Arrive at "Open folder" and Hit Enter.
4. Select the Node Modules folder from your Computer.
5. Using Tab, Navigate to a file you want to view and Hit Enter.
6. Visually observe the how Variables, Functions, Modules, Loop Statements , Exceptions, function Names and Variables Names etc are differentiated in High Contrast Theme.

**Expected Result:**
There should be visual  Color Differentiation between Functions and Loops Statements or Exceptions of code snippets in High Contrast Theme.
**Actual Result:**
High Contrast Theme:
1. All Functions, Loops, Modules, Exceptions are defined in Blue color in High Contrast.
2. All Variable Names, Functions Names are White in Color in High Contrast Theme. 
3. Statements are defined in Bolden Orange color

Dark+(Default Dark):
1. Functions and Modules are defined in Blue Color.
2. Loops and Exceptions are defined in Pink Color.
3. Variable Names are defined in Sky Blue Color.
4. Statements are defined in Orange color
4. Function Names are defined in Yellow Color.

**User Impact:**
Low Vision users will not be able easily understand the areas of code snippets without visual color differentiation.

![example 1_there is no visual color differentiation between functions and loops statemens or exceptions of code snippets in high contrast theme](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21185531/0d13dd66-c237-11e6-9946-6a2437666bf3.jpg)
![example 2_there is no visual color differentiation between functions and loops statemens or exceptions of code snippets in high contrast theme](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21185533/0e136c4a-c237-11e6-8310-275d1a349849.jpg)

data.title: Accessibility:MAS42A:Menus and context menu are not adapting to high contrast theme

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
VS Code Version:1.6.1
OS Version:1607

**Pre-Requisite:**
1.Open visual studio code editor.
2.Using "Ctrl+Shift+P" key Open the command Pallete.
3.Type Theme, Navigate to Preferences: Color Theme and Hit Enter.
4.Navigate to High Contrast and Hit Enter.

**Steps to Reproduce:**

Scenario 1:
1.Open visual studio code editor.
2.Observe the Menu Bar Visually
Scenario 2:
1. Open visual studio code editor.
2. Hit "Ctrl+Shift+G" to view the Git side bar and Navigate to more button and Hit Enter.
3. Observe the options under More button in High Contrast Theme
Scenario 3:
1. Open visual studio code editor.
2. Hit "Ctrl+Shift+X" to view the Extensions side bar and Navigate to more button and Hit Enter.
5. Observe the options under More button in High Contrast Theme.

**Expected Result:**
Scenario 1:
Menu Bar and options under Menu Bar should Adapt the High Contrast Theme of VS Code Editor
Scenario 2:
Icons under More in Git Repository side bar should Adapt the High Contrast Theme of VS Code Editor
Scenario 3:
Icons under More in Extension Repository side bar should Adapt the High Contrast Theme of VS Code Editor.

**Actual Result:**
Scenario 1:
Issue 1: Menu Bar and options under Menu Bar is not Adapting the High Contrast Theme
Observation: While using OS High Contrast Black Theme, Menu Bar is Partially adapting the OS High Contrast Theme. Issue here is Focused Sub Menu is not Highlighted according to the High Contrast Black Theme
Scenario 2:
Options under More in Git Repository side bar are not Adapting the High Contrast Theme of VS Code Editor
Scenario 3:
Options under More in Extensions side bar are not Adapting the High Contrast Theme of VS Code Editor

**User Impact:**
Low Vision users will not be able to clearly view the options under Menu Bar as it's not adapting the High Contrast Theme.

![scenario 1_ menu bar and options under menu bar are not fully adapting the high contrast black theme of windows](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21185322/30e5e474-c236-11e6-9f4f-b93f104b5eb0.jpg)
![scenario 1_ menu bar and options under menu bar is not adapting the high contrast theme of vs code editor](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21185328/37065168-c236-11e6-8407-dbe1710e01ac.jpg)
![scenario 2_options under more button in extensions side bar is not adapting the high contrast theme of vs code editor](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21185334/3b15768a-c236-11e6-95fd-5c48746db947.jpg)
![scenario 2_options under more button in git side bar is not adapting the high contrast theme of vs code editor](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21185338/3d8d70e8-c236-11e6-9b29-1a8cb6a0ba1e.jpg)

data.title: Accessibility: MAS40B: Inspect: Name Property of the Files opened Starts with "tab" and Localised Control Type is missing for these files
data.body:
VS Code Version:1.6.1
OS Version:1607

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1.Open Visual studio code editor.
2. Open any file from Explorer Side Bar.
3. Navigate to the Name of the opened file and Observe Name and Localised Control Type Property in Inspect.

**Expected Result:**
'Name Property of the Files should contain only the file name displayed and Localised Control Type should be "Tab"
1. Name Property should be "tasks.json"
for file tasks.json which is opened and Localised Control Type should be "Tab"
Narrator Behavior:
Narrator should read as "tasks.json, tab "
NVDA Behavior:
1. NVDA should read as "tasks.json, tab " on Keyboard Navigation and 
on mouse hover.

**Actual Result:**
'Name Property of the Files opened Starts with "tab" and Localised Control Type is missing for these files
1. Name Property is "tab,tasks.json"
for file tasks.json which is opened
Narrator Behavior:
Narrator reads as "tab,tasks.json"
NVDA Behavior:
1. NVDA doesn't read anything on Keyboard Navigation 
2. NVDA reads the Text displayed "tasks.json" on mouse hover.

**User Impact:**
Users relying on screen readers will gets confused if it's announced as "tab,tasks.json" or if it's not announced at all.

![name property of the files opened starts with tab and localised control type is missing for these files](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21184912/8c87b6d8-c234-11e6-9da6-2e93dd07fc1b.jpg)

data.title: Accessibility: MAS40B: Inspect: 'IsExpandCollapsePatternAvailable' property is FALSE for Git or Extensions or Tasks combo box in Output Panel.
data.body:
VS Code Version:1.6.1
OS Version:1607

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1.Open Visual studio code editor.
2. Open any file and using "Ctrl+1" key  navigate to the first vs code editor.
3. Using F1 key navigate to the palette, type "git branch" and "refactor-to-promise" as the branch name
4. Make changes to the code by refactoring, adding/deleting new lines
5. Compare the changes between the HEAD and current file by navigating to View Bar ---> Git ; Navigate to changes and hit ENTER to activate "Diff View" 
6. Stage and commit the changes under View Bar ---> Git  ; Navigate to the "Commit Staged"  button and hit ENTER to make a commit
7. Undo the commit by navigating to the toggle button (same row as commit staged), hit ENTER and use down ARROW to choose "Undo Last Commit" option 
8. Navigate to "More Button" in Git Side Bar and Hit Enter.
9. Navigate to "Show Git Output" and Hit Enter.
10. Navigate to "Git or Extensions or Tasks" combo box in output panel and observe 'IsExpandCollapsePatternAvailable' property in Inspect.

**Expected Result:**
'IsExpandCollapsePatternAvailable' property should be TRUE for Git or Extensions or Tasks combo box in Output Panel.
Narrator Behavior:Narrator should read as "Git editable combo box Git collapsed".

**Actual Result:**
'IsExpandCollapsePatternAvailable' property is FALSE for Git or Extensions or Tasks combo box in Output Panel
Narrator Behavior:
Narrator reads as "Git Git, editable combo box"
NVDA Behavior:
NVDA reads as "Git combo box Git collapsed"

**User Impact:**
Users relying on screen readers will not know if the toolbar is expanded or collapsed.

![isexpandcollapsepatternavailable property is false for git or extensions or tasks combo box in output panel](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21184697/a110dbb2-c233-11e6-9d9d-6b3147122e11.jpg)

data.title: Accessibility: MAS40B: Inspect: 'IsExpandCollapsePatternAvailable' property is FALSE for "Open Editors" Toolbar.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
VS Code Version:1.6.1
OS Version:1607

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1.Open Visual studio code editor.
2. In 'Explorer' pane. Navigate to 'Open Editors' toolbar.
3. Using Inspect, Check its "IsExpandCollapsePatternAvailable" property.

**Expected Result:**
'IsExpandCollapsePatternAvailable' property should be TRUE for "Open Editors" Toolbar.

**Actual Result:**
'IsExpandCollapsePatternAvailable' property is FALSE for "Open Editors" Toolbar.
Narrator Info:- Narrator announces as "Open Editors Section, tool bar".
NVDA Info:- NVDA focus goes to the toolbar but announces nothing.
Note: Issue exists for all such toolbars/menus in the app.

**User Impact:**
Users relying on screen readers will not know if the toolbar is expanded or collapsed.


![toolbar expand collapse false](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21184497/bcee9442-c232-11e6-9778-f81ea9009084.png)

data.title: Accessibility: MAS40B: Inspect: Inappropriate 'Name' property for "Path Text Box" in 'Select Destination Location' window in Visual Studio Code editor installation wizard.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
VS Code Version:1.6.1
OS Version:1607

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Open Visual Studio Code editor installation wizard.
2. Click Next and Go to 'Select Destination Location' window.
3. Tab to the "Path" text box besides "Browser" button.
4. Using inspect, check it's 'Name' property.

Note:
Issue also exists for Text box in next window 'Select Start Menu Folder' of the installation.

**Expected Result:**
' 'Name' property should be appropriate and meaningful.

**Actual Result:** 
'Name' property is not meaningful. Inspect shows "To continue, click Next. If you would like to select a different folder, click Browse" as Name property.
Narrator Info:-  Narrator announces like "Tab
To continue, click Next. If you would like to select a different folder, click Browse., editing text, C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code".
NVDA Info:-  NVDA announces like "To continue, click Next. If you would like to select a different folder, click Browse., text, Selected C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code"

**User Impact:**
Users relying on screen readers will get confused if the name property is not meaningful and inappropriate.

![browse name prop 2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21184116/00cdb37a-c231-11e6-9187-39f6bd991975.png)

![browse name prop](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21184124/03d8ea62-c231-11e6-938b-77a2267943a2.png)
![path no name](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21184127/06700a8a-c231-11e6-9c34-e95f01e5050c.png)

data.title: Accessibility:MAS40B:Name and Help text values are empty for the top level menu

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
VSCode Version:1.6.1
OS Version:1607

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1.Open visual studio code editor.
2.Hit 'Alt+F' to open "File" menu bar option.

**Expected Result:**
Name and help text value should be present in the  inspect tool for the "File" menu bar.

**Actual Result:**
Name and help text values are empty for the "File" menu bar option.
Note1: The same issue is observed in other (Edit,View,Go,Help) menu bar options.
Note2: Shortcut keys for "Command Pallete" are "f1" or "Ctrl+Shift+P".
Note3: Inspect and Narrator Buddy Information is attached 

**User Impact:**
Screen reader will not recite the name of the menu bar name for the blind user accessing it.


![inspectinformation_visualstudiocodeeditor_filemenubar](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21183763/7289a2b4-c22f-11e6-8117-3f64e215fc78.jpg)
![nvda announces as menu submenu for file menu bar](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21183769/76e08e0e-c22f-11e6-96ea-fd51323c7728.jpg)

data.title: Accessibility: MAS40B: Inspect: 'Name' property is Null for Tree Item under 'BreakPoints' Section in left pane.
data.body:
VSCode Version:1.6.1
OS Version:1607

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1.Open Visual studio code editor.
2.Using "Ctrl+Shift+D" key navigate to the debug side view bar option.
3.Navigate to the Tree Item  under 'Break Points Section'.
4.Using Inspect, check its "Name" property.

**Expected Result:**
Tree Item under 'Break Points' Section should have a meaningful and appropriate "Name" property.
Eg: Name property should be "All Exceptions" for All exceptions Tree Item .

**Actual Result:**
"Name" property is null for Tree Item under 'Break Points' Section
Narrator Info:- Narrator announces as "1 of 3, Header, header updated, All Exceptions".
NVDA Info:- NVDA focus goes to the checkbox but announces nothing.
Observation: If the Breakpoint is Selected, then the Name Property is not Null.

**User Impact:**
Users relying on screen readers will get confused if the name property is not meaningful and inappropriate.


![breakpoint checkbox null name](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21183484/257b1fd0-c22e-11e6-9f21-e35bf99d771b.png)

data.title: Accessibility: MAS40B: Inspect: 'Name' property is empty for "Debugging ToolBar" Panel.
data.body:
VS Code Version:1.6.1
OS Version:1607

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1.Open Visual studio code editor.
2.Using "Ctrl+Shift+D" key navigate to the debug side view bar option.
3.Open the launch.json file under the "Configure or Fix: launch.json"button and select "Node.js" from the drop down list.
4. Add configurations to "launch.json" utilizing IntelliSense with CTRL+SPACE.
5. Start debugging by pressing F5.
6. Using Inspect, check 'Name' property for "Debugging Tool Bar" Panel.

**Expected Results:**
"Name" property should not be empty. Pane should have a meaningful and appropriate name.
Eg: Name property should be "Debugger Options Toolbar Panel".

**Actual Result:**
' 'Name' property is empty for the "Debugging ToolBar Panel.
   Note: 'IsKeyboardFocusable' property is also FALSE for the same "Debugging ToolBar" Panel.
**User Impact:**
Users relying on screen readers will get confused if the name property is not meaningful and inappropriate.


 
![debugging toolbar name and focus](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22956130/21183252/2143254e-c22d-11e6-96aa-d5cf7193584a.png)

data.title: Allow to move the "Opened Editors" view below the file explorer
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.7.2 **[Unsupported]** (7ba55c5860b152d999dda59393ca3ebeb1b5c85f, 2016-11-21T22:01:10.756Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.3.0

Now we can hide `opened file folder in siderbar`
It's would be more efficient to have an option to move `opened file folder in sidebar` below `opened dir` since the `opened dir` would not float up-and-down when open new file or close file.

data.title: TypeScript misses document symbols
data.body:
* open https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/code/electron-main/windows.ts
* trigger outline
* search for `ready`
*  you get only one result, but there is [`IWindowsMainService#ready`](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/code/electron-main/windows.ts#L92) and [`WindowsManager#ready`](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/code/electron-main/windows.ts#L156) 

![screen shot 2016-12-14 at 12 39 59](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1794099/21180684/7187f8aa-c1fa-11e6-9cc7-d66261c6182d.png)

data.title: indent not following setup
data.body:
- VSCode Version:  1.7.2
- OS Version: RHEL 7.3

Steps to Reproduce:

1. edit and save js file
2. despite the fact Indent is setup to 2 spaces, indent takes 4 spaces in file, see pic:
![vscode_indent](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/499820/21180674/63ece5d4-c1fa-11e6-9434-c903a323978e.png)

data.title: Orphaned quote crashes Sass
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.7.2 (7ba55c5860b152d999dda59393ca3ebeb1b5c85f, 2016-11-21T22:01:10.756Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a new document
2. Set language mode to Sass
3. Type a quote mark " or '  and delete the closing quote if it's auto added.
Any line of text with an orphaned quote mark will do.
4. Move cursor to column 1 (start of the line) and press TAB.

Desired behaviour:
Pressing TAB should indent the text regardless of valid code etc.

The problem:
VSCode seems to freeze.
